{{also|spräche}} ==German== ===Etymology=== From {{etyl|goh|de}} {{m|goh|sprāhha}}, from {{etyl|gem-pro|de}} {{m|gem-pro|*sprēkijō}}, cognate with {{cog|nl|spraak}}, {{cog|en|speech}}, {{cog|da|sprog}}, {{cog|sv|språk}}. ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|de|/ˈʃpʁaːxə/|[ˈʃpʁäːχə]|[ˈʃpʁɑːχə]|[ˈʃprɑːxə]}} * {{audio|de|De-Sprache.ogg}} * {{a|Austria}} {{audio|de|De-at-Sprache.ogg}} {{IPA|de|[di‿ˈʃpɾɑːχə]}} ===Noun=== {{de-noun|f||Sprachen}} # {{lb|de|countable}} [[language]] {{gloss|body of words, and set of methods of combining them}} #: {{ux|de|Ist Deutsch eine schwere '''Sprache''' zu erlernen?|Is German a difficult '''language''' to learn?}} #: {{ux|de|Sie lernt sehr gern '''Sprachen'''.|She loves to learn '''languages'''.}} #* '''2010''', ''[[w:Der Spiegel|Der Spiegel]]'', issue [http://www.spiegel.de/spiegel/print/index-2010-32.html 32/2010], page 102: #*: Das Buch wurde in mehr als ein Dutzend '''Sprachen''' übersetzt und verkaufte sich millionenfach. #*:: The book was translated into more than a dozen '''languages''' and sold more than a million copies. # {{lb|de|uncountable}} [[speech]] {{gloss|style of speaking}} #: {{ux|de|jemandem die '''Sprache''' verschlagen|to leave somebody speechless|inline=1}} #: {{ux|de|Du benutzt eine sehr gehobene und höfliche '''Sprache'''.|Your '''manner of speech''' is very elevated and polite.}} # {{lb|de|uncountable}} [[speech]] {{gloss|faculty of uttering articulate sounds or words; the ability to speak}} ====Declension==== {{de-decl-noun-f|n}} ====Hyponyms==== : ''See:''
